column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: New Hampshire

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column6: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column8: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.

column2: 2. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: defensive driving

column2: 3. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column4: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.
column6: passing is allowed for both drivers.
column10: passing is allowed during daylight only.

column2: 4. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Octagon

column2: 5. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column8: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.

column2: 6. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the right side of the road.
column6: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column8: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column10: look toward the left side of the road.

column2: 7. Many crashes are caused by:
column4: frequently checking mirrors and blind spot.
column8: maintaining a 4-second following distance between your vehicle and any vehicle in front of you.

column2: 8. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column6: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: 360 degree turn ahead.

column2: 10. Passing is prohibited:
column4: at intersections.
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column8: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Merge
column10: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 12. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
column4: be ready to stop.

column2: 13. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column10: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Stop Sign Ahead

column2: 16. This sign means:
column4: no turns are allowed on this road.
column10: the road may be slippery when wet.

column2: 17. To safely pass a bicyclist you should:
column4: leave a safe distance when passing, and maintain clearance until safely past the overtaken bicycle.
column6: The other answers are all correct.
column8: honk at the bicyclist to let them know youre trying to pass.
column10: rush ahead to pull in front of the bicyclist.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: School zone ahead

column2: 19. When you approach a railroad crossing, but you do not see a train. You must stop:
column4: if a stop sign is posted.
column6: if the crossing lights are flashing.
column8: if a crossing gate is lowered.

column2: 20. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
column4: Drinking coffee

column2: 21. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column4: accelerate quickly and pass.
column6: watch for children walking along the side of the road.

column2: 22. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
column4: changes in traffic lanes.

column2: 23. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column6: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

column2: 24. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the left lane.
column10: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 25. To avoid crashes with vehicles in your blind spots, you should:
column4: quickly turn your head to see if your blind spot is clear, before changing lanes.
column6: adjust your rear-view mirrors every few minutes.
column8: sound your horn right before turning or changing lanes.

column2: 26. When entering a crowded freeway, to merge into traffic you should:
column4: yield to vehicles already on the freeway.
column8: use the acceleration lane to adjust your speed to the same speed as freeway traffic.

column2: 27. Signs containing information about hazardous conditions are known as _____ signs.
column4: regulatory

column2: 28. This sign means:
column4: Railroad crossing ahead
column6: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 29. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column4: the left side

column2: 30. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.

column2: 31. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column6: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column8: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column10: remain near the left edge of the road.

column2: 32. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: increase your speed to provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle.
column6: slow down until it passes you.
column10: pull over to the side of the road and stop.

column2: 33. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column6: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column10: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.

column2: 34. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: You must pass the school bus.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column10: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 35. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Do not enter.

column2: 36. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: No U-Turn

column2: 38. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: guide drivers.
column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 39. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column6: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column8: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column10: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.

column2: 40. When you drive into the street from any driveway you:
column4: must honk the horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can allow you room.
column6: can disregard pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
column8: must drive slowly so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can get out of your way.
column10: must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.
